title: A Beginner's Guide for Delivery Drivers
headline: Learn how to become an effective delivery driver and keep the vehicle in good condition with this free online course.
description: The benefits of good delivery driver training extend beyond the drivers themselves as increased customer satisfaction boosts business revenues. This training course explains everything you need to know about the responsibilities of delivery drivers. We explore various delivery and collection methods and the different lifting tactics used to avoid injuries. You will also master good record-keeping and learn how to effectively plan delivery routes.
courseDescription:
Delivery drivers form the backbone of modern logistics as they transport items like food, furniture and equipment to their final destinations. Would you like to become an effective delivery driver? This course introduces you to the characteristics and types of delivery personnel, such as heavy and tractor-trailer truck drivers, and identifies the physical demands of the job. We provide tips to help you travel safely and outline loading and unloading techniques. We go over packaging guidelines used to avoid damage to different types of packages.

The course then discusses several ways to prevent vehicles from moving during loading and unloading. We trae the relationship between record-keeping and service delivery and establish the benefits of keeping accurate records. Learn how to plan routes and use navigation software to improve driver speed and efficiency. Discover factors leading to stress, their effects on drivers and how to manage stress levels on the road. We lay out the process of acquiring the United Kingdom’s ‘Certificate of Professional Competence’ for drivers.

Finally, we look at the traffic rules and speed limits you must follow for safe and secure driving. The course studies the factors to keep in mind when setting the speed limit before explaining general parking rules and processes. We provide guidelines for driving in adverse weather conditions and define ‘zero contact’ deliveries. This course suits anyone working in or managing road deliveries and their crucial role in today’s supply chains. A little extra training can turn your driving ability into a career.
